user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of UtAssert_EndTest:
```c
void UtAssert_EndTest(void)
{
    uint32                 Ct;
    bool                   SegmentValid;
    UtAssert_TestCounter_t Local_SegmentCounters;
    char                   Local_SegmentName[sizeof(CurrentSegment)];

    UT_BSP_Lock();

    SegmentValid = (UT_SegmentCounters.TotalTestCases > 0);
    if (SegmentValid)
    {
        ++UT_TotalCounters.TestSegmentCount;
        UT_SegmentCounters.TestSegmentCount = UT_TotalCounters.TestSegmentCount;
        UT_TotalCounters.TotalTestCases += UT_SegmentCounters.TotalTestCases;
        for (Ct = 0; Ct < UTASSERT_CASETYPE_MAX; ++Ct)
        {
            UT_TotalCounters.CaseCount[Ct] += UT_SegmentCounters.CaseCount[Ct];
        }
        memcpy(&Local_SegmentCounters, &UT_SegmentCounters, sizeof(Local_SegmentCounters));

        /*
         * note, strcpy is OK because both are fixed size buffers of the same size,
         * and the null termination on CurrentSegment was locally enforced already
         */
        strcpy(Local_SegmentName, CurrentSegment);
    }

    memset(&UT_SegmentCounters, 0, sizeof(UT_SegmentCounters));

    UT_BSP_Unlock();

    if (SegmentValid)
    {
        UtAssert_DoTestSegmentReport(Local_SegmentName, &Local_SegmentCounters);
    }
    else
    {
        UT_BSP_DoText(UTASSERT_CASETYPE_END, "No test cases\n");
    }
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
UtAssert_DoTestSegmentReport(Local_SegmentName, &Local_SegmentCounters);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The call itself does not prove a violation. From this fragment alone we cannot tell whether Rule 8.13 is violated because that depends on the declaration of UtAssert_DoTestSegmentReport. If the function is declared to take a const-qualified pointer (e.g. const UtAssert_TestCounter_t * or const char * for the name) then there is no violation. A violation would occur if UtAssert_DoTestSegmentReport is declared to take a non-const UtAssert_TestCounter_t * but the function does not modify the pointed-to counters — in that case the parameter should be const UtAssert_TestCounter_t *.
